intro: Elatostema melanocarpum, commonly known as the black-fruited elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruits are typically dark-colored, which gives it its common name. Elatostema melanocarpum often grows in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
